ok, then the worst that can happen is you will have to do a restore if it all goes wrong. If you have manually partitioned, I recall there is a window in the partition editor where it says which partitions will be formatted (there's a column with checkmarks in it). Can you see that?
yes
if i check mark those drives the ohters will be safe?
only the partitions with format checkmarks will get their data erased, so as long as that's correct, you won't lose data. The rest will be untouched...

also, if I recall correctly, the boot manager has it's own little dialog which comes later in the installation process. Usually, it autodetects the windows installation and 'does the right thing'. If it doesn't, you can usually correct it manually after linux boots...
